title: Authors and Citation
text: Stef van Buuren. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Team G (2025). gsedread: Tools reading GSED validation data. R package version 0.12.0, https://github.com/D-score/gsedread.
code: @Manual{,   title = {gsedread: Tools for reading the GSED validation data},   author = {GSED Team},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.12.0},   url = {https://github.com/D-score/gsedread}, }

what: Tools for reading the GSED validation data
title: Tools for reading the GSED validation data
text: goal gsedread read validation data project Global Scales Early Development (GSED).

title: Tools for reading the GSED validation data
text: Install gsedread package GitHub follows: CRAN version.

title: Tools for reading the GSED validation data
text: need access proper SharePoint site sync data local OneDrive. file .Renviron home directory add line specifying location synced OneDrive, e.g., setting environmental variable ONEDRIVE_GSED, restart R, manually check whether able read OneDrive directory. following commands reads SF data GSED Final Collated Phase 1 Data Files 18_05_22 Sharepoint directory returns tibble one record per administration. Count number records per file: Process variable names user-friendly alternative:
code: ONEDRIVE_GSED='/Users/username/Library/CloudStorage/OneDrive-Sharedlibraries-...' head(dir(Sys.getenv("ONEDRIVE_GSED")), 3) #> [1] "Archive Data dictionaries" "Data Merge"                #> [3] "Final Data Analysis" library(gsedread) data <- read_sf() dim(data) #> [1] 6350  160 table(data$file) #>  #>                ban_sf_2021_11_03 ban_sf_new_enrollment_17_05_2022  #>                             1543                               72  #>     ban_sf_predictive_17_05_2022                pak_sf_2022_05_17  #>                              473                             1761  #> pak_sf_new_enrollment_2022_05_17     pak_sf_predictive_2022_05_17  #>                               72                              459  #>                tza_sf_2021_11_01 tza_sf_new_enrollment_10_05_2022  #>                             1427                               74  #>     tza_sf_predictive_10_05_2022  #>                              469 rename_vector(colnames(data)[c(1:3, 19, 21:25)], lexout = "gsed2", trim = "Ma_SF_") #> [1] "file"      "gsed_id"   "parent_id" "date"      "gpalac001" "gpacgc002" #> [7] "gpafmc003" "gpasec004" "gpamoc005"

title: Tools for reading the GSED validation data
text: package reads processes GSED data. store data. read_sf() read_lf() functions takes following actions: Constructs paths files OneDrive sync file; Reads specified datasets list; Internally specifies desired format column; Specifies available date data-time formats per file; Recodes empty, NA, -8888, -8,888.00 -9999 values NA; Repairs problems mixed data-time formats adaptive Pakistan data; Stacks datasets one tibble adds columns file adm; Removes records without GSED_ID. Item renaming rename_variables() relies item translation table https://github.com/D-score/gsedread/blob/main/inst/extdata/itemnames_translate.tsv.

title: Tools for reading the GSED validation data
text: study supported Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation. contents sole responsibility authors may necessarily represent official views Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation agencies may supported primary data studies used present study.

what: Define column types for data reading — define_col
title: Define column types for data reading — define_col
text: Define column types data reading

title: Define column types for data reading — define_col
code: define_col(   ins = c("sf", "lf", "bsid"),   adm = c("fixed", "adaptive", "tan", "pak", "ban"),   date_format = "",   datetime_format = "" )

title: Define column types for data reading — define_col
text: ins Character, instrument adm Character, fixed adaptive date_format Specification read date field datetime_format Specification read datetime field

what: Read data from Bayley Scales of Infant Development III — read_bsid
title: Read data from Bayley Scales of Infant Development III — read_bsid
text: Read data Bayley Scales Infant Development III

title: Read data from Bayley Scales of Infant Development III — read_bsid
code: read_bsid(   onedrive = Sys.getenv("ONEDRIVE_GSED"),   path = "GSED Final Collated Phase 1 Data Files 18_05_22",   verbose = FALSE,   progress = FALSE,   warnings = FALSE )

title: Read data from Bayley Scales of Infant Development III — read_bsid
text: onedrive Character, location local OneDrive sync path Character, path name within OneDrive verbose Logical. Print diagnostic info? Defaults `FALSE`. progress Logical. Show progress interactive session. Default `FALSE`. warnings Logical. Show warnings generated `readr::read_csv()`. Defaults `FALSE`.

title: Read data from Bayley Scales of Infant Development III — read_bsid
text: tibble original data two column names: `file` (containing original file name) `adm` (fixed adaptive).

title: Read lf data — read_lf
text: Read lf data

title: Read lf data — read_lf
code: read_lf(   adm = c("fixed", "adaptive"),   onedrive = Sys.getenv("ONEDRIVE_GSED"),   path = "GSED Final Collated Phase 1 Data Files 18_05_22",   verbose = FALSE,   progress = FALSE,   warnings = FALSE )

title: Read lf data — read_lf
text: adm Character, either "fixed" "adaptive" administration type onedrive Character, location local OneDrive sync path Character, path name within OneDrive verbose Logical. Print diagnostic info? Defaults `FALSE`. progress Logical. Show progress interactive session. Default `FALSE`. warnings Logical. Show warnings generated `readr::read_csv()`. Defaults `FALSE`.

title: Read lf data — read_lf
text: tibble original data two column names: `file` (containing original file name) `adm` (fixed adaptive). `adm == "fixed"` tibble 159 columns, one test administration per row. `adm == "adaptive"`, tibble 14 columns, one item administration per row.

title: Read lf data — read_lf
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # assuming environmental variable ONEDRIVE_GSED has been set d <- read_lf() dim(d) } # }

title: Read sf data — read_sf
text: Read sf data

title: Read sf data — read_sf
code: read_sf(   adm = c("fixed", "adaptive"),   onedrive = Sys.getenv("ONEDRIVE_GSED"),   path = "GSED Final Collated Phase 1 Data Files 18_05_22",   verbose = FALSE,   progress = FALSE,   warnings = FALSE )

title: Read sf data — read_sf
text: adm Character, either "fixed" "adaptive" administration type onedrive Character, location local OneDrive sync path Character, path name within OneDrive verbose Logical. Print diagnostic info? Defaults `FALSE`. progress Logical. Show progress interactive session. Default `FALSE`. warnings Logical. Show warnings generated `readr::read_csv()`. Defaults `FALSE`.

title: Read sf data — read_sf
text: tibble original data two column names: `file` (containing original file name) `adm` (fixed adaptive). `adm == "fixed"` tibble 159 columns, one test administration per row. `adm == "adaptive"`, tibble 14 columns, one item administration per row.

title: Rename character vector — rename_vector
text: Translates names different lexicons (naming schema).

title: Rename character vector — rename_vector
code: rename_vector(   input,   lexin = c("original", "original_phase2", "sequential", "gsed", "gsed2"),   lexout = c("gsed2", "original", "original_phase2", "sequential", "gsed"),   notfound = "copy",   contains = c("", "Ma_SF_", "Ma_LF_", "bsid_"),   underscore = TRUE,   trim = "Ma_",   lowercase = TRUE,   force_subjid_agedays = FALSE )

title: Rename character vector — rename_vector
text: input character vector names translated lexin string indicating input lexicon. One "original", "original_phase2", "sequential", "gsed" "gsed2". Default "original". lexout string indicating output lexicon. One "original", "original_phase2", "sequential", "gsed" "gsed2". Default "gsed2". notfound string indicating input value found contains string filter translation table prior matching. Needed prevent double matches. default ("") filter. underscore Replaces space (" ") dash ("-") underscore ("_") trim substring removed `input`. Defaults "Ma_". lowercase Sets variables lower case. `lexin`? default `notfound = "copy"` copies input values output value. cases (e.g. `""` `NA_character_`), function uses string specified `notfound` replacement value. force_subjid_agedays `TRUE`, forces output `"subjid"` `"agedays"` names `"ID"` `"age"`, respectively.

title: Rename character vector — rename_vector
text: character vector length `input` processed names.

title: Rename character vector — rename_vector
code: input <- c("file", "GSED_ID", "Ma_SF_Parent ID", "Ma_SF_C01", "Ma_SF_C02") rename_vector(input) #> [1] "file"         "gsed_id"      "sf_parent_id" "gpalac001"    "gpacgc002"    rename_vector(input, lexout = "sequential", lowercase = FALSE) #> [1] "file"         "GSED_ID"      "SF_Parent_ID" "C01"          "C02"          rename_vector(input, lexout = "gsed", trim = "Ma_SF_") #> [1] "file"      "gsed_id"   "parent_id" "gsdlac001" "gsdcgc002"  # SF/LF phase 2 names to default names input <- c("file", "GSED_ID", "Ma_SF_Parent ID", paste0("Ma_SF_C00", 1:9)) rename_vector(input, lexin = "original_phase2", lowercase = TRUE) #>  [1] "file"         "gsed_id"      "sf_parent_id" "sf_c001"      "sf_c002"      #>  [6] "sf_c003"      "sf_c004"      "sf_c005"      "sf_c006"      "sf_c007"      #> [11] "sf_c008"      "sf_c009"

title: gsedread 0.12.0
text: Adds script data-raw/R/build_database_fixed.R create duckDB datasets fixed LF, SF BSID administration Adds script data-raw/R/build_database_adaptive.R store adaptive SF LF (Phase 1 ) Adds internal read_gsed_fixed() function read fixed LF, SF BSID (Phase 1 Phase 2) data Removes outdated data-raw/data/Data_File_Guide.xlsx Adds script data-raw/R/patch_phase2_files.R identify repair problem Phase 2 LF SF data Specify Latin1 format read CSV files read_sf() Extends rename_vector() option translate SF/LF phase 2 names

title: gsedread 0.11.0
text: Defines Phase 2 source file names date formats read_sf() read_lf() functions

title: gsedread 0.10.0
text: Adds force_subjid_agedays option rename_vector()
